category: Human Rights Management Regulations/Article 30 (Conducting Human Rights Impact Assessment)
contents: Article 30 (Conducting a Human Rights Impact Assessment) The Chairman shall conduct a human rights impact assessment as follows. 1. The scope of the human rights impact assessment covers issues that affect the human rights of athletes, employees of sports associations and related organizations, and stakeholders, including the overall operation of the organization and major projects. 2. The human rights management department supervises the human rights impact assessment and can request related data from each department and affiliated organization. 3. The human rights management department may periodically conduct surveys related to the living and working conditions of Gyeonggi players and employees when necessary in relation to the human rights impact assessment. 4. If necessary, the department in charge of human rights management may entrust the human rights impact assessment to an external independent agency to conduct it. 5. The Human Rights Management Committee deliberates and adopts the results of the human rights impact assessment. 6. Detailed procedures and methods for human rights impact assessment shall be established and implemented separately depending on the case.
